intro: Trachymene anceps, commonly known as the slender false Solomon's seal, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender, erect stems. Trachymene anceps is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native gardens and ecological restoration projects.
